name: Hyperaldosteronism with Paradoxical Hypokalemia
chief_complaint: I feel so weak and thirsty all the time, and my muscles keep cramping
prognosis: Good with proper treatment, but requires lifelong monitoring for recurrence or complications of chronic hypertension
description: A rare variant of primary hyperaldosteronism where excessive aldosterone secretion leads to paradoxical hypokalemia despite the hormone's typical potassium-sparing effects. The condition involves a complex dysregulation of renal sodium-potassium exchange channels and is often caused by bilateral adrenal hyperplasia or aldosterone-producing adenomas.
